item.title: This teen made $100,000 in bitcoin and now he's crowdfunding a VR headset
item.description:
This teen made $100,000 in bitcoin and now he's crowdfunding a VR headset

His grandma gave him $1,000 when he was 13 years old, and he invested it in bitcoin. A year annd a half later, he cashed out, netting $100,000. At 15, he turned that into Botangle, an online tutoring service. Now that he's 17, Erik Finman is jumping into the world of virtual reality.

item.title: Did Satoshi transfer several bitcoin domains before disappearing?
item.description:
Did Satoshi transfer several bitcoin domains before disappearing?

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. It's 100% free, no registration required. Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top Wikipedia Satoshi's page says that: Nakamoto continued to collaborate with other developers on the bitcoin software until mid-2010.

item.title: CSIRO to Look into the Potential of Blockchain Technology in Australia - NEWSBTC
item.description:
CSIRO to Look into the Potential of Blockchain Technology in Australia - NEWSBTC

Australia's premier research institution CSIRO to conduct an investigation into blockchain technology and its potential uses. Read more... The relationship between Bitcoin and Australia has been a roller coaster ride so far.

item.title: Bitcoin Searches More Than Double According To Google Trends
item.description:
Bitcoin Searches More Than Double According To Google Trends

Google Trends is always something fascinating to keep an eye on, especially when one is invested in Bitcoin and FinTech. The most recent report shows how the number of Google searches has gone up by 200% in the past week, which should come as no surprise.

item.title: Bitcoin Markets Hold Steady, But Brace for More Craig Wright Details - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Markets Hold Steady, But Brace for More Craig Wright Details - CoinDesk

Bitcoin markets experienced little change on 2nd May, providing a mild response to Craig Wright's claim that he is in fact the digital currency's inventor. The Economist, the BBC and GQ all released stories on the subject that day, following months of speculation surrounding whether Wright created bitcoin.

item.title: London Startup Colony Wins Grand Prize at Consensus 2016 Competition Event
item.description:
London Startup Colony Wins Grand Prize at Consensus 2016 Competition Event

Colony, a London-based startup aiming to leverage P2P and blockchain technologies to create a decentralized marketplace for freelancers, was awarded $10,000 in prize money during today's Proof of Work startup competition, which was held at the Consensus 2016 fintech conference.

item.title: 8 Pressing Questions for 'Bitcoin Creator' Craig Wright
item.description:
8 Pressing Questions for 'Bitcoin Creator' Craig Wright

On May 2nd, the self-proclaimed "Bitcoin creator" Australian professor, Craig Wright, announced to the world (yet again) that he is the man behind the the Satoshi Nakamoto pseudonym. This time, he came with proof by purportedly using Satoshi's signature as shown on BBC. But how valid was his "proof-of-satoshi"?

item.title: Steemit rewards social media content creators with cryptocurrency
item.description:
Steemit rewards social media content creators with cryptocurrency

Steemit announced Tuesday the release of a public beta version of its social media content aggregator developed to reward content creators and curators with cryptocurrency, said a press release sen...

item.title: The Search for Bitcoin's Creator Misses the Point of Bitcoin
item.description:
The Search for Bitcoin's Creator Misses the Point of Bitcoin

Satoshi Nakamoto is the mysterious inventor of the cryptocurrency bitcoin. The name could represent anyone or a group of people, and since bitcoin's creation in 2008, there have been a lot of theories about who Nakamoto really is. . Most recently, and presented evidence in December that Nakamoto was Australian computer scientist Craig Wright.

item.title: Forex Broker Inc - Visit the Trading Academy
item.description:
Forex Broker Inc - Visit the Trading Academy

Forex Broker Inc. is a trading platform registered in the Marshall Islands, with its headquarters in Belize and the European Offices in Malta. The company website is very easy to use and simple to navigate and it offers some of the best and most highly-regarded trading platforms in the industry.
